intro: Noronhia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered noronhia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a slightly hairy texture. Noronhia densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
